jobDescription: Responsibilities and duties: 1. Coordinate daily with influencers and MCNs of overseas short video or social platforms for placement and business negotiations; 2. Maintain relationships with overseas influencers, manage core influencer resources, and ensure smooth cooperation; 3. Collaborate with the growth department to jointly form cross-border content and placement strategies, and work with influencers on campaign execution according to goals and campaign stages; 4. Swiftly integrate overseas seeding resources and ensure efficient matching of internal and external needs; 5. Adjust media placement strategy of overseas influencers based on performance metrics to ensure ROI. Preferred skillsets: 1. Candidates with overseas influencers resources preferred; 2. Candidates with interest in overseas social media platforms and experience in contacting overseas influencers preferred; 3. Candidates with overseas education background / overseas working and living experience, familiarity with foreign cultural environment preferred; 4. Excellent command of English, bachelor’s degree or above, candidates majoring in journalism, media, and marketing preferred; 5. Excellent communication and execution skills, positive attitude, honesty, result oriented mindset.

Responsibilities: • Develop partnerships with banks and non-bank payments service providers to proactively grow and maintain all aspects of the user relationship ensuring alignment with Temu’s online payment strategy • Identify new business opportunities for Temu and bank partners within our suite of Platform solutions • Build and maintain relationships with partner bank executives. Drive end-to-end process for partnerships including identifying prospects, managing pipeline, negotiating contracts etc. • Empower and educate our partner management functions to maximize their effectiveness in engaging and growing partners that are most relevant to audiences • Collaborate with various teams, both in US office as well as worldwide to support the achievement of Concern’s mission Preferred skillsets: • 5+ years of experience in business development or partnership management • Finance institution related experience is preferred • Relevant experience in dealing with banks, successfully establishing and growing institutional relationships with payments service solution providers • Demonstrated strategic, analytical, and problem solving experience • Ability to develop, review and negotiate complex contracts and familiarity with standard deal structures including financial and tiered pricing structures • Ability to travel overseas on short-term assignments • Chinese language skill is preferred • Eligibility to work in the US
